1.verse: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

2.verse: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

3.verse: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

4.verse: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

5.verse: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

6.verse: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

7.verse: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

8.verse: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

9.verse: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

10.verse: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

11.verse: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

12.verse: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

13.verse: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

14.verse: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

15.verse: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

16.verse: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

17.verse: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

18.verse: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

19.verse: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

20.verse: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

21.verse: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

22.verse: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

23.verse: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

24.verse: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

25.verse: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

26.verse: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

27.verse: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

28.verse: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

29.verse: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

30.verse: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

31.verse: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

32.verse: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

33.verse: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

34.verse: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
